title: U.S. Reaches Preliminary Trade Deal With Europe
summary: The United States and the European Union agreed to a 15 percent base tariff after weeks of negotiations, which were among the Trump administration’s most difficult discussions.

title: For Trump, E.U. Trade Deal was Badly Needed
summary: After a lot of big talk on trade, the Trump administration needed a big win. It appears to have just gotten one.

title: U.S. and China Meet as Trade Truce Nears Expiration
summary: Top American and Chinese officials are meeting for two days of talks in Stockholm as the Trump administration tries to complete trade deals.

title: A Timeline of Trump’s Tariff Fight With Canada, Mexico, China and the E.U.
summary: The president’s penchant for imposing and then suspending tariffs has shaken markets and confounded trading partners.

title: Israel Says It Has Paused Some Military Activity in Gaza as Anger Grows Over Hunger
summary: Operations in parts of the enclave were put on hold to allow more aid. It was unclear if the move would relieve the hunger crisis, amid rising deaths from starvation.

title: News Organizations Urge Israel to Let Reporters and Aid Into Gaza
summary: Saying that journalists in the territory, like many Gazans, are facing starvation, the groups urged Israel to allow more food in.

title: What Will It Cost to Renovate Trump’s ‘Free’ Air Force One? Don’t Ask.
summary: To hide the cost of renovating the plane Qatar donated to President Trump, the Air Force appears to have tucked it inside an over-budget, behind-schedule nuclear modernization program.

title: Massie Criticizes Johnson on Recess as He Tries to Force Epstein Files Vote
summary: “I don’t know why it should be politically painful to be transparent,” Representative Thomas Massie, a Kentucky Republican, said on Sunday, referring to comments by Speaker Mike Johnson.

title: Alpha School, AI-Driven Education Founded in Austin, Is Coming to More Cities
summary: At Austin’s Alpha School, students spend just two hours a day on academics, led by artificial intelligence tools. New Alpha schools are set to open in about a dozen cities this fall.

title: Last Soldiers of an Imperial Army Have a Warning for Young Generations
summary: As the 80th anniversary of the end of World War II approaches, only a few veterans of Japan’s brutal war remain. “Never die for Emperor or country,” one advised.

title: Tom Lehrer, Musical Satirist With a Dark Streak, Dies at 97
summary: A mathematician by training, he acquired a devoted following with songs that set sardonic lyrics to music that was often maddeningly cheerful.

title: Thai-Cambodian Conflict Tears at Remnants of a Once-Proud Empire
summary: People on both sides of the border share a cultural heritage much older than modern nation-states, dating back to the ancient Khmer civilization.

title: U.S. Will Join Thailand-Cambodia Cease-Fire Talks, Rubio Says
summary: Negotiations to end the border conflict, which has killed dozens of people since it began last week, are scheduled for Monday in Malaysia’s capital.

title: The Country Where 76% of Cars Sold Are Electric
summary: Subsidies, hydroelectricity and a manufacturing powerhouse neighbor are moving the cars into Nepal faster than almost anywhere else.

title: Suspect in Traverse City Walmart Stabbing Attack Faces Terrorism Charge
summary: The authorities on Sunday said that a motive for the attack, which left 11 people injured, remained unknown. Citizens, including one who was armed, helped to apprehend the suspect, officials said.

title: 5 Money Mistakes That Can Put Retirement Farther Off
summary: Even people with employee-sponsored retirement plans still find it difficult to save for the future when faced with present-day desires.

title: England’s Lionesses Take ‘Football Home’ With Gripping Euro Win
summary: By edging out Spain in a penalty shootout in the European championship final, England’s women’s team cemented its position as the standard-bearer for English soccer.

title: What We Talk About When We Talk About the Right of Return
summary: My Palestinian mother-in-law has been displaced since 1948

title: ‘1984’ Hasn’t Changed, but America Has
summary: Some of the same titles and authors the C.I.A. sent east during the Cold War, including “1984,” are now deemed objectionable across the United States.

title: ​North Korea Rejects New South Korean Leader’s Peace Overtures
summary: In its first comment on President Lee Jae Myung of South Korea, North Korea dismissed a call for dialogue, dampening hopes of a new chapter in relations.

title: Passengers Evacuate Smoky American Airlines Plane at Denver Airport
summary: A small fire in the brake system just ahead of the jet’s takeoff prompted the evacuation of 173 passengers and six crew members, the authorities said.

title: Joan Anderson, Unsung Heroine of Hula Hoop History, Dies at 101
summary: Because of a deal made on a handshake in a parking lot, she was long left out of a famous toy’s story. When she was 94, a documentary changed that.
